Package de.unisaarland.cs.se.selab.commands

Class Command

java.lang.Object
de.unisaarland.cs.se.selab.commands.Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivateRoomCommand, EmptyCommand, LeaveCommand, PlaceBidCommand, PlayerCommand, RegisterCommand, StartGameCommand
public abstract class Command extends Object
Superclass for all commands/actions.

  • Method Details

    • inPhase

      public Set<State.Phase> inPhase()
      Returns a set of game phases in which this command is valid, i.e., may be executed.
      Returns:
      the set of game phases

    • execute

      public ActionResult execute(Model model, ConnectionWrapper connection, State.Phase phase, Player player)
      Execute a player command/action.

      Certain commands/actions are executed for a single player individually. This version of the execute() function takes that player as an additional parameter. The default behavior is the same as execute(Model, ConnectionWrapper, State.Phase). However, the PlayerCommand overrides this function to check whether it is the given player's turn.

      Parameters:
      model - the model to which the action based changes should apply
      connection - the connection to the client to transmit events
      phase - the game phase in which this command/action was triggered
      player - the current player for this action
      Returns:
      a result that indicates how the game should continue
      See Also:
      • PlayerCommand

    • execute

      public ActionResult execute(Model model, ConnectionWrapper connection, State.Phase phase)
      Execute a command/action.

      This method implements some general checks, e.g., whether this command may be executed in the current game phase. If the checks succeed, this method calls run(Model, ConnectionWrapper). So, for most commands it suffices to override the run() function.

      Parameters:
      model - the model to which the action based changes should apply
      connection - the connection to the client to transmit events
      phase - the game phase in which this command/action was triggered
      Returns:
      a result that indicates how the game should continue

    • run

      a result that indicates how the game should continue
